headline: Fast English Muffin Pizzas
description: This English muffin pizza recipe is very fast and very kid-friendly. Pizza sauce, cheese, and pepperoni make this a great snack or anytime meal!

video.description: Individual pizzas made on English muffins with sauce, cheese and pepperoni.
video.name: Fast English Muffin Pizzas

name: Fast English Muffin Pizzas

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Arrange the English muffin halves cut-side up on a baking sheet. Spread pizza sauce evenly on top of each one; sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and top with pepperoni slices.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and browned on the edges, about 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: For those who are giving a low rating because you didn't toast the muffins first, that's not fair. It's about taste preference, so some people may like it toasted and others may not. Next, I DID toast SOME of the muffins because, again, taste preference for some. One of my kids likes them toasted and one doesn't. I used pizza sauce, laid down the pepperoni on some since one of my kiddos doesn't like pepperoni, and then added a blend of cheese. I take mozzarella, some parmesan, and then shredded Havarti cheese, and I mix them together in a bowl. I add the cheese blend to the top of the pepperoni so it keeps the pepperoni in place. Finally, I baked at 350* for 6-8 minutes since my gas oven is super finicky and likes to go from still frozen to burnt in 2 seconds if you aren't careful. When I pulled them from the oven, I set out some marinara sauce for dipping, cut some of them up lengthwise, and two of my kids dipped them in marinara for extra zip. This is one of those recipes that can be altered based on preferences. Yes, you should toast the muffins first if you don't want them too soft. You can also place in the oven to get lightly browned before adding toppings if you don't have a toaster, as some people don't. These can also be done in the microwave in case that's the only cooking appliance someone has. (This was, unfortunately, a reality for my family a few years ago. There are a TON of microwave options that can make hearty meals if you don't have any other way to cook.) Overall, a great recipe for a quick lunch or snack option. You could even use these as a super quick dinner option by throwing in some garlic bread/knots or breadsticks and a salad. (This can also be adjusted to add sausage, bacon, etc. Muffins themselves are extremely adaptable to toppings used, so use your imagination and create something yummy!)

I did a few things to make this suite my tastes and my daughter enjoyed it as well. I used Rao's pizza sauce (a little pricier but worth it), hand grated from a block of mozzarella vs pre packaged. And finally placed them on this rack I had for cooking bacon so it wasnt against a solid surface. I used the same preheat temp recommended, threw them in at about 150, and waited for the cheese to brown along the edges before pulling them and they weren't soggy for me, even the thicker cut muffins. I think it was about 15 minutes.

Since I only had salsa on hand, I used it as a pizza sauce substitute. It was quite flavorful. I leave it in a lil longer fir the crunch. But either way is a fun treat fir the family. Or if you haven't gone shopping in ahwile, ir on a budget and need to be creative fir your family meal. Add a little side salD!!ðŸ˜Š
Major bummer. Ruined the only chance I had at a meal bc it didn't say you need to TOAST the muffins first. Please toast them or you'll have a soggy, unpalatable mess. Boooo on this recipe for sure :(
Easy as English muffin pizzas can be
We made plain cheese. I wish the muffins were more toasty. Other than that not bad for a quick dinner.
Quick and yummy!!
My family loved this and it was quick and easy and we will be doing this again.
So easy and delish! I added stuffed garlic olives and sliced onions as well. Great flavour. I used Chef Boyardee Pizza Sauce with cheese. A great snack for everyone.
I made mine with slices of sausage and my boy ate ate all of it. I count that as a with

I remember eating these as a kid so I was excited to make them for my kids. I don't remember my Mom toasting the muffins first, and I have to say this step is a GAME CHANGER - they were so crunchy! I will be making them again, thanks for the recipe.
Absolute awesomeness! Just don't forget to toast the halves before you put whatever toppings are your favorite on it.. mistake not to toast, soggy if you don't..
The sourness of the muffin made for an interesting flavor combination. I would recommend a sweeter pizza sauce to balance.

I've been making this recipe since I was a little girl. I was born in 1966. The current year is 2021. So I want to say I was three when I had my first one so 52 years ago Still my go-to when I'm hungry and tired but want a good meal with a side salad. highly recommend using Thomas's English muffins for this and not a cheaper version.
Excellent. Hit the spot and easy to make.
Fast and delicious.

Super fast and easy! It was also super fun to add yummy toppings, like pineapple and salami! This is a great idea for a party, so that people can have a more personalized pizza and itâ€™s homemade. Definitely would make again!
I like that you can use different toppings.

I followed the recommendation of toasting the bread first. I didnâ€™t have pizza sauce so I used tomato sauce and just added oregano and some Parmesan cheese and they came out delicious. So simple to do.
My kids LOVE this! Theyâ€™re 2 and 4 and itâ€™s actually something they can do without too big of a mess.
Great dish !!!!
This is a great recipe, quick and easy and the kids enjoy making there own personal touches to them!!

My husband and I are on weight watchers and have been doing really well. This recipe was the perfect treat to curb our pizza craving yet keep within our points and portion control. We used light English muffins and Boarâ€™s Head turkey pepperoni. They were awesome!
I had to use pasta sauce so i got meat flavored and used a silicon brush to apply it.
My kids loved these little pizzas! They're quick and simple. My own mother has been making English muffin pizzas like these for years!
Yes and Absolutely
Always a big hit, especially my daughter who loves putting her pizza together herself. I add green peppers and olives to mine, but the rest of the family is happy with straight-up pepperoni.

If you need a super quick dinner idea for a house full, these mini pizza's were just right! Everyone loved that they could add what ever toppings they wanted. Plus our kids were able to help out all the w
It was a hit! For adults and kids! I also used the easy pizza sauce III recipe for this.
Fun, easy & versatile!

These are easy, quick to make and remind me of my childhood but if you donâ€™t toast the English muffins in the oven or toaster before you put the sauce and topping some on them then the muffins are soggy, floppy and hard to bite into. If you want them to be more like pizza and taste better then you need to toast them! 
*I remembered this too late and had already followed the directions of this recipe so I let them cool, added more cheese and put them back in the oven for 10 minutes and that helped crisp up the bottom so they werenâ€™t so soggy and made them a little more edible and taste like pizza.

Have made similar recipe for 30+years. Most people can eat a regular size pizza. My version: 3 English muffins split on a large pizza pan. 1/4 piece of American cheese on each one. Spoon LG tablespoon sauce over this. Chop up your toppings of choice. I like pepperoni, sausage,and mushroom. You decide how much topping you want, I use about 2T. for each muffin half. A shake of parmesan cheese,and a TBS. or more of shredded mozzarella. Bake at400Â° for 10-12 min. on top shelf of oven. Then broil on high till top browned to your liking. It's a very flexible recipe. Play with it. It's that type of recipe, I love it.
This is a great & easy recipe for on-the-go pizza. Easy to handle and even to pack for lunches! I used my own homemade pizza sauce and it was amazing. Kids will definitely love this.

Made recipe as is and it was good, but next time I will definitely toast the muffins first before adding the toppings and putting the pizzas back in to bake. As is they were a little too soft and the pizza sauce made them a little soggy. Still good but would have been better toasted first. No regrets though, will make again!!!

Pretty good, but there is just one thing you need to change. Before you put it in the oven, make sure to put your English muffin in the toaster before, otherwise you will have a soggy pizza. Otherwise, it was very quick and easy, and tasted good.
Best ever reminds me of my childhood and the kids loved them. Itâ€™s a keeper.
we love this, but we add toppings like peppers and chopped up broccoli. Super easy and super yummy!

not exactly haute cuisine, but a fond childhood memory - our little parochial school had hot lunches every friday. the favorite main dish by far were these little guys - i can still taste them 50 years later!
We thought these were great! I do like the idea as another reviewer suggested to toast the muffins first, so I may try that next time, but they were still tasty as is~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)

Pretty good, quick & easy. Toasting the english muffins first is a must! Try the mini pepperoni or chop up the regular slices to fit on the english muffin better. I also added some finely chopped sweet onion on top of the pepperoni and a sprinkle of garlic powder to the sauce before the cheese. Yum!
Per suggestion of other reviewers, I toasted the muffins. I thought the pizza muffins had little flavor. Will not try again.

I have been making these for years and years. They are foolproof and absolutely delicious. There is no end to the varieties you can try. I turn the broiler on for a couple of minutes at the end just to crisp up the toppings. They freeze really well also!
Wow I have been making these for years and all the readers suggestions toasting the muffins first made them so much better!!
Great and easy recipe. Made them about 20 minutes before my wife and son got home. Quick, easy late dinner after sports night. Loved them. Leftovers for lunches tomorrow.

I was hungry for something, but not willing to cook just for myself . My hubby has a flu bug and had chicken soup. I didn't want that. So I thought, I bet I could make pizza out of english muffins. So, I found the recipe. I did toast the muffin first. I used the spaghetti sauce in the fridge. It had ground beef in it. I just topped with cheese. These were wonderful.. I can't wait for the grand kids to come over, so I can let them make them. Thanks
I only used two muffins, and baked for the same amount of time and temperature in our toaster oven and it still came out fantastic. This is a recipe that will live on in our household.
Super easy and delicious the kids love them. I like to put olive on on the English muffin and toast them before adding the pizza sauce and cheese gives it a crunchy crust.
Next time I'm going to toast the halves first. :)

My grandma used to make this for us. I looked up the recipe just to find the time and temp. It is now our once a week lunch recipe that my children will be able to start making all on their own. Love recipes like that.
Hmm made with the oven interesting way to go, for years I've been doing it with a toaster and microwave. Tomato sauce is a new idea I would have never thought of

We made these in the sixties, as kids they were our favorites. Just made them for my husband tonight (he is retired) and we still laughed about how good and easy they are. Yes, use Thomas' English muffins so the sauce goes into the cracks. Use good pizza sauce, good pepperoni and cheese and you won't be disappointed. Add some crushed red pepper flakes for the adults if you like a little heat.
Great for a quick dinner. The kids love them.

My daughter loves making these. Usually for lunch the day after we had spaghetti. Jarred Pizza sauce works great. So does pasta sauce (I make homemade sauce with ground beef usually). Using that and some mushrooms it's a delicious, filling meal. Make them as written if you like (they're awesome!). However, we prefer to toast the English muffins first so they don't get soggy from the sauce.

Been Makin since 1970. I found toasting muffin 1st then add toppings is best. Sure my kids r grown & on their own, but I still make em for myself, also can use hoagie buns, bagels, hard rolls, french bread, etc. Let ur imagination go.......yummy....
These are the perfect quick and easy dinner or snack. Lightly toast the muffins first, don't use a lot of sauce; pepperoni and black olives on top of the cheese.
Tasted great, but turned out soggy. Wish I would have read the reviews first to know to toast them!
After school snack for the kids that they can make :)

Made a large amount of these for a relative who was ill. Cooked fully, then placed on baking sheet in freezer until fully frozen. Popped them in a bag, and she absolutely loved them! The only change was adding fresh basil from my garden.

They turned out great, perfect for a quick snack or a small meal. For those that prefer a crispier crust, I broil mine for around 4 minutes instead of baking them. They are nicely toasted and all the toppings piping hot.
Brush the muffins with a little bit of olive oil and pre-toasting the muffins before assembly is a small tweak that really brings out the flavors and helps to prevent them from being too soggy.
Very easy and versatile recipe!

Quick and easy! What more can you ask for? The kids loved making their own little pizzas. The best part is how versatile the recipe is. Pineapple and ham, sausage and pepperoni ... the possibilities are endless. No more bickering over what kind of pizza to get. Everyone has their own. I baked these on a preheated pizza stone, so I had no problem with soggy muffins. We will be making these again for sure!
I made this with mini slices of homemade bread and it was crispy and delicious. I also added pizza seasoning to each piece ! Easy and yummy !
This was so good. We did not have any English muffins at the time that I needed to make these but, we had plain bagels and it was a great substitution and caused to make a great meal!

The only thing I will add to this is.....if you want them crispy, either toast the muffins in the toaster first or put them in the oven for a few minutes before putting the ingredients on....much better this way!!!
My mother made these for us years ago. When I had my own kids, I toasted the English muffins first -- I have a bit of a soggy bread phobia. Toasting before adding sauce did the trick for me.
When I was a child my mother would make these on toasted hamburger buns. Now I make them for my great granddaughter. It's fun for the children to help with no matter how young they are.

Ive been making these for years and still love them. Like just about everyone else said, toast the english muffin first. Also, I've always used the broiler rather than baking them in the oven so they cook much faster but can easily burn. I suppose I'll try my toaster oven next time. I have loved these little pizzas for years!

I made these for my kids when they were young. Great idea for birthday parties. Cut up the different toppings, place them in bowls and let the kids make their own. Don't forget to toast the muffin first!

I have been making these pizzas for almost 40 years but with sausage. So easy and my kids and 8 grandkids love them. We make them now with whatever each individual likes, from just cheese to thin sliced peppers and onions or mushrooms.
These were good. Just make sure the pizza sauce is warm.
I first learned how to do these little pizzas in the early '80s. Very yummy! You can also add canadian bacon or any precooked topping.
Wow! These are SOO GOOOOD!!
My family makes these tasty beauties out of love.

This was a lot of fun for my 4-year old because she could put together her own and feel like she "cooked" her own dinner. I did follow the suggestions of the some of the other commentators and toasted the muffins first. For my daughter I followed the recipe as it was written (minus the pepperoni because she's not a fan). For mine, I subbed in fresh tomato slices for the canned sauce, and instead of pepperoni I added fresh garlic and some dried basil. SO GOOD. I personally think the fresh tomato version is a lot better than the canned sauce, but both were good and this recipe was definitely fast and easy like it promised.
Its quick & easy kids like it, a little tip cut in 3 put in oven like 5 min or until light golden brown then add just as they say not soggy, the way my gram made them :)
These are great for a quick easy dinner. We have had them several times over the years and they are good. I like to add a little bit of garlic and a few mushrooms to them sometimes.

a delicious snack! i did not measure the cheese or the pizza sauce because you can just put as much on as you want. i did not toast/bake them before i cooked them, because that would be too crispy for me. i will definitely make again!

I've been making these for the last twenty years. I was a kid and remember watching a kid show when I learned about these. 

My kids and Husband love them!
Super easy meal for during the week! Dress them up however you like - we used turkey pepperoni, green peppers, and onion!
Wish we had read the reviews first and then I would have toasted the muffins first. Still very good but would have like them more if we toasted the muffins first.

I love the crust and toppings but in the middle of the muffin it would get soggy. For the last two minutes I turned the oven on broil so the cheese would really melt, also I cut the pepperoni into smaller pieces before I put it on the pizza. Other than that it's was pretty good

I love english muffin pizzas. The only thing I do different is I lightly toast the english muffin first or it is soggy on the bottom. Very yummy, very quick and so simple when you need something fast!
loved this just tried it!

These have always been a quick and easy "go to" in my house. They are fun to make when my super picky brothers are coming over! My brothers will eat several at a time and that is saying something since all they normally eat is cereal and chicken nuggets.
Great, remember to bake your muffins first so they dont get soggy!
Easy for a kid to help with. I would pre-toast next time.

These are great! My mom used to make them for us as kids, and my sister makes them. I think I may have made them once a few years ago too, but I wasn't sure about the oven temperature, cook time, etc., so I pulled this recipe. I did not read the other reviews before cooking, so I did not toast the muffins. Instead, I cooked at 350 for 10 minutes as directed, but then turned the oven to broil for 2 to 3 minutes more. They tasted great - I don't think you need to toast them. We had ours as Hawaiian pizzas with ham and pineapple, but you could use whatever you want. They are very easy and versatile.
Kids love these!! They are quick and easy enough for my 4 year old to make. And she's so proud she makes dinner!! Of course, I put them in the oven.

These are great and the toppings you can use are endless. My son had friends over for a football party. I set up toppings in small dishes (onions, diced tomatoes, sliced olives, crumbled sausage, bacon, pepperoni slices, jalapeno slices, pineapple tidbits, etc) and let everyone assemble their own. It was a huge hit and all the kids loved it. I've tried them with the mini bagels as well as English muffins and both are great. I agree that you need to toast them before assembly.
This was great. I followed the advice of others and toasted the English muffin first. My husband and son loved it!

Im a student and this is a really good snack to make while studying for midterms lol I added feta on the top and left it in the oven longer so it would be more crispy... delicious my brother kept trying to steal them
Very quick and easy. The kids loved them. I followed the recipe as written, but can think of many variations that would be more "grown up"

Try it with ketchup, instead of the pizza sauce, 
Thank you RHONDA35
Easy and good!

I wasn't in the mood to cook dinner tonight so decided to make these quick english muffin pizzas. I read the reviews first so I toasted the muffins before adding sauce and toppings, which I think is a must! No need to measure the sauce, cheese and pepperoni, just eye ball it. Great easy snack or meal especially when served with a salad.
These were really good!!!
Great late night snack! or whenever I don't feel like cooking a big meal.I added a little parsley garlic powder .
Love it! So easy. :)
